intro: Lycianthes lycioides var. iodastera, commonly known as the iodastera lycianthes, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, peppers, and potatoes, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields due to its adaptability to various soil types. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
